column5: We wasted the morning bite on the little fish. From 12 to 6:00 we were on the big ones. After that we trolled for a bit for pickerel and then decided to get back before it started to get dark. I am unfamiliar with that place. We would have slayed them on top water... Then we fished around the marina till about 7:30. After loading the boat and talking to the marina guy we were on our way home by 8:30.
Was a good outing 4 sure, well done boys...
you guys got into the bass nice job the rod tip sucks
Wow, long day with lots of fish, gotta love it!
excellent report JB. Wow...you really got some nice fish....especially those 'average size' basseessessesses...nice one!
Great report as always.  You always slay the bass.  Hence your name.  It must have been one hell of a day.  Can't wait to see your next report.
Gotta love those all day fishing trips.    I don't get to do many of those anymore.  Congrats on the great day and thanks for the report.
wow that sure is one heck of a day of bassin!  Im seriously jealous!!!!!!!  Cheers!

Pat called me and told me he wanted to try Georgian Bay on Wednesday. Me and Snagmasteral were supposed to go up but SMA was busy and couldn't go till next week. So I ask SMA for a few spots that he said were hot and we were on our way.  Got there and the water was nice and flat. I decided to work a Pop R near the marina. Seconds in Pat hooks a largie on a senko.    I get a fish come right out of the water but missed my Pop R. Pat starts nailing largies, smallies, and pike on his senkos. Nothing big but some decent action. Then he lost a 5-6 lb pike right at the boat on a spinner bait.  I decide to switch to the 3/8 ounce jig and pigs I bought. I tell Pat, FINALLY I got the J&P I have confidence in. I go watch this. First cast to a dock? Fish on. But it was a pike.    Caught another smally or two and that was it for the J&P.  I also hooked a smallie and had a 3-4 lb pike attack it. Partrick tried to net both the fish but was unsuccessful.Other than a few battle scars the smallie was ok and released.  We wasted the morning bite on that spot. Too many small fish. Our first smallies of the day.     I said lets go check Al's spot.  On the way there we cast around with minimal luck. Then we are driving around, there is a spot that looks good. We decide to cast. I get a decent smallie and then Pat hooks into this nice 20 incher!!!    Continued the pattern and caught numerous smallies.Heres the average size.    Then we were working pads and Pat nails this nice Largie!    Then Pat smacks another nice Smallie!    The only thing is when he landed the fish, the tip of his rod broke. Bummer.....  Then we started fishing deep water weed lines and started hooking into all kinds of decent Largemouth.        Here is a few other fish Pat caught.    We got stopped by the MNR. He checked us out and we started to continue fishing.  Then we decided to try Al's pattern. There were no fish around but as we were drifting away from the area, it droped off and I hooked this pig!!! Amazing battle!    Here is another shot of it.    And that was it. Then we decided to go back to the largie pattern. We caught a few more but that was about it.    I decided to search for shoals. We found a weedflat instead and that is when we started hammering them again! Caught quite a few nice fish.Here are a few.        Anyways, on the way there I was telling Pat, that he better not lose any more big fish. Well.....Pat didn't lose any big fish....I lost SIX in the 3-4lb range. Most spitting the hook on the jump(one looked in the 5lb range). I weas screwing around jigging my tube franctically and he hit it like a freight train. Headed for the skies and that was it.  I also hooked something that felt big.And next thing you know. I hear SNAP.Look at the line and its all frayed. I'm thinking it was a pike.  Well minutes later doesn't Pat catch a 1lb smallie with my lure in its mouth??It probably was bulldogging behind a big boulder and the line snapped.  The fish were fighting incredibly strong. Even the small ones!  At this point we had caught so many Bass that Pat wanted to troll for pickerel. We tried and all I caught was a smallie, not much bigger than the crank bait I was using.lol  On the way back to the marina we decided to fish the first spot that produced a big fish. I hook something with some serious weigh that took me into the weeds and I couldn't budge it. I had 8lb test and was using my pickerel rod all day with no back bone. I decided to drive around it with the trolling motor. If finally got free but My line was still caught up in the weeds. try to pry it and SNAP!!!heartbreaker. Couldn't bring that fish no where near the surface so didn't get a look at it!Oh well.  Made it back to the marina area, since I don't know the area too well. Cast around, caught a little largie and called it a day.  Seen a skunk for the second time in a row coming back from fishing! I hope its not a bad sign.lol  Anyways, another great fishing adventure with Patrick. Special thanks goes to Snagmasteral for pointing us in the right dirtection. We had scoped out the spot on the map and were thinking of giving it a try but AL pretty much guaranteed we would. I hope I got all the pics and I hope you guys enjoyed the report.
Johnny B, awesome report man!  We are glad to see you are back to form with the shirtless pics  :)  Where abouts did you guys launch out of?  Port Severn? Honey? Penetang?
Ooutstanding!
Nice work guys! Thanks for posting it Johnny! I'd say you guys had a blast! HH
gorgeous report guys..u guys killed them...gotta love gbay....i have been wanting to get ou there for the past two weeks but danm school is holding me back.
great report!
PM sent.
Wow, great day of fishin there JB!  Lots of awesome bass, must have been wild.
Thanks guys.  Well at least we know they are still there 2 weeks later! So there is still time! Hopefully the weather co-operates and we can hit it again!
Great Report, looks like an awesome day on the water.
GREAT REPORT Johnny Bass!!! Nice BASSES!! Thanks for sharing!!!

Johnny B.....Great job on the SMB's & LMB's.... You guys really pounded them Loads of fun when the bite is on There's some real nice chunky ones in those pics......MAN the size of the guts is unreal That was surely a blast catching them one after another! Again great job and thanks for sharing Leechman

Awsome report JohnnyB, an exciting read at that.  Good job on that under the dock pike that he didnt steal your confidence JignPig.  Some of those bass are hogs.  right there is an amazing day on the water, thanks for sharing.  I find later in summer and throughout the fall concentrating on deep weedlines produces some of the best bass fishing all year!  WTG!
Nicely written Johnny, i can't believe the amount of fish we pulled in, a definite again spot to hit and i held pretty good with 3 hours sleep .
Great stuff JohnnyB, you & Pat outta be giving fish'n lessons with days like that
Wow!! You guys laid a beating on those fish!  congrats!  Love fall weather....jackets and touques in the morning and shirtless in the afternoon.  Great pics!
Great Report! You guys landed some nice fish. What was the most productive structure?  -R-
Nearly a perfect time out on the water, congrads on all those nice bass(and pike and the perch too)
way to put on a show boys!
Awesome job guys, sounds like you found action just about everywhere you went.  Gotta love days like that.
You guys got a lot of fish - great work.  How long were you on the water?
We got on the water it was still kinda dark and we left around 8:30PM.
Great Job!  Nice bass!
Weed lines next to deep water.
BEAUTY BUCKETS BOYZ
